intro: Cephalandra mackenii, commonly known as the silver vine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that often have a silvery or white vein pattern. It produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are followed by bright red berries. Cephalandra mackenii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care.
